sections.purpose: To sterilize prepared media, glassware, and accessories using programmed steam cycles.
procedure: Load media bottles or flasks into the sterilizer chamber with space between items.
Select the appropriate sterilization program and temperature.
Start the cycle and monitor indicators for temperature and pressure.
Allow the sterilizer to complete the sterilization and exhaust phases.
Open the door slightly to release residual steam, then fully after cooling.
Remove sterilized media carefully and inspect for cracks or volume loss.
Record cycle parameters in the logbook.
precautions: Ensure caps are loosened to prevent bottle breakage.
Perform regular biological indicator tests for validation.
Allow sufficient cooling time before handling hot media.
